definition: A structural component or part of an animal's body that is exclusive to members of the animal kingdom, such as organs, tissues, or body parts not found in plants or other organisms.
opposite_reasoning: PlantAnatomicalStructure provides the strongest taxonomic opposition - both concepts represent organized biological structures but from mutually exclusive kingdoms (Animalia vs Plantae). This creates a clean biological parallel: animal-specific organs/tissues vs plant-specific organs/tissues. The opposition is semantically meaningful, conceptually clear, and maintains domain consistency (both are anatomical structures, just from different kingdoms). This is ideal for Fisher-LDA as it separates two well-defined biological feature spaces. While less directly relevant to AI safety/deception detection, it provides robust concept separation for biological knowledge representation.
